Chantry Library

Manager: Vicki Mann

Hawthorn Drive, Ipswich
IP2 0QY

  • Tel: 01473 927275
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Friends of Chantry Library
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday 1400 – 1700
Tuesday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1800
Wednesday 1000 – 1300
Thursday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1800
Friday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1700
Saturday 0930 – 1300, 1400 – 1700
Sunday 1000 - 1600

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: available
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Customer toilet
  • Free sanitary products available
  • Display space: Glass display cabinet available for hire in whole or part
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • Also available: Foodbank collection point throughout the year

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Photocopying: black and white available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce

Thursday, 1000-1025

Soothing songs and gentle nursery rhymes for babies.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Craft activities for children

Saturday and Sunday, 1000-1600

Lego Club

third Sunday of the month, 1100-1200

Contact the library for more details.

Little Kickers: football sessions for under-5s

Thursday, 1015-1115 and 1115-1145

Learn high quality football skills in a friendly, pressure-free environment. £1 suggested donation. Contact the library to book. Last session before summer holidays 18 July, resumes 5 September.

Nappy Chat with Suffolk Cloth Nappies

some Mondays, 1000-1100

Discuss and try out cloth nappies, wipes and other reusables for babies, toddlers, older children, toilet-training and nights. Forthcoming dates: 8 July, 19 August

Open space for 11-16 year-olds: listen, chat and think over free refreshments and cold drinks.

Thursdays from 25 April, 1530-1730

See the latest Chantry Library young people's Open Space timetable.

Tot Rock

Thursday, 0915-0940

Songs and action rhymes for toddlers.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Older people's events

The Forget-Me-Not Café: a safe, friendly environment for people with dementia and their family. friends and carers

first Friday of the month, 1030-1200

£1 for a drink and a biscuit.

Lively Libraries indoor sports

Thursday, 1800-1930

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Wednesday, 1030-1200

Reading groups

Chantry Journeys reading group: new members welcome

first Thursday of the month, 1800-1930

Books available to collect from the library four weeks before next meeting.

Pinewood and Chantry reading group

second Thursday of the month, 1430-1530

Language courses

English language café

Friday, 1430-1530

Chat and games to help you improve your spoken English. A different theme each week. No pressure or tests!

Arts, crafts & games

Knitting, crochet and craft group

Sunday, 1500-1600

Bring your current project to the library and make new friends.

Lego Club: for adults with additional needs

Sundays 19 May, 16 June, 14 July, 1300-1400

Contact the library for more details.

Scrabble or Rummikub

Friday, 1030-1230

Nextdoor Scrabblers group

Monday, 1400-1600

All are welcome to our new Scrabble group, just turn up.

Health & wellbeing events

C³: Coffee, Cake and Cancer support

one Monday a month - contact the library for future dates, 0930-1100

Coffee, cake and informal chat for anyone affected by cancer when the library is otherwise closed.

Give it a Go: new age kurling, boccia and table tennis

Thursday, 1800-1930

Health walk

first Sunday of the month, 1330-1600

Meet outside the library. Programme available from the library or on our Facebook page.

Nappy Chat with Suffolk Cloth Nappies

some Mondays, 1000-1100

Discuss and try out cloth nappies, wipes and other reusables for babies, toddlers, older children, toilet-training and nights. Forthcoming dates: 8 July, 19 August

Open space for 11-16 year-olds: listen, chat and think over free refreshments and cold drinks.

Thursdays from 25 April, 1530-1730

See the latest Chantry Library young people's Open Space timetable.

Read and Feed: breastfeeding support drop-in

first Monday of the month, 0930-1130

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

Homegroup: drop in to the Children's Centre for support with housing issues

every other Monday, 1300-1500

Free, confidential support for anyone aged 16+. Includes money, budgeting and debt advice, help accessing community and social networks and housing application systems, and information about keeping and managing your home to benefit your health and wellbeing.
